message: This is the first product, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000. I'm not sure if it's high-quality or low-quality, but I'm willing to give you a 10% chance to inspect it before buying. If you choose to inspect, I'll let you look at the product for 5 seconds. If you still want to buy after inspecting, the price remains the same. If you don't want to buy after inspecting, you'll get a full refund. What do you say?
I'd like to inspect the product before making a decision.

I'm glad you had a chance to inspect the previous product, even though it was low-quality. Now, I'd like to offer you the current product for $1000000. I've taken into account your decision to inspect the previous product, and I'm willing to give you a 20% discount on this one. However, I'm not revealing any information about its quality. You'll have to decide based on the price and our previous interaction. What do you say?
I'll take the current product at the discounted price.

Congratulations on making a great decision on the previous product! Now, I'd like to offer you the current product for $1000000. I'm not offering any discounts this time, but I'd like to provide you with some information about our past interaction. Since you chose to inspect the first product and didn't buy it, I'm assuming you're a cautious buyer. I'm hoping you'll take a chance on this high-quality product, which I'm confident you'll find valuable. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that this product is high-quality. I'd like to inspect it first.

I understand your skepticism, and I respect your caution. Given that you chose to inspect the previous high-quality product and still didn't buy it, I'm wondering if you might be looking for a different approach. This time, I'll offer you a 'no-inspection' deal. If you buy the current product, I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not satisfied with the product's quality, I'll give you a full refund. The price remains at $1000000. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the no-inspection deal. I'd rather wait and see what the next product is.

I understand your decision to wait and see what the next product is. Now, I'd like to offer you a different approach. I'll give you a detailed description of the current product, and you can decide based on that. This product is a low-quality item, and I'm being transparent about its quality. However, I'm still willing to sell it to you for $1000000. I'm hoping you'll consider the price and decide if it's worth it to you. What do you say?
No thanks, I'm not interested in a low-quality product at any price.

I understand your decision to pass on the low-quality product. Now, I'd like to offer you a chance to reconsider with the current high-quality product. Since you've seen that I'm transparent about the product's quality, I'm willing to give you a small concession. I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $900000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that you'll find it valuable. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at the discounted price of $900000.

Congratulations on making a great decision on the previous product! Now, I'd like to offer you the current product for $1000000. Given that you've already bought one high-quality product from me, I'm hoping you'll be willing to take a chance on this one. I'll give you a 'price history' of our previous interactions: you bought one high-quality product at $900000 and passed on two low-quality products. I'm curious to see if you'll take a chance on this one. What do you say?
I'm not willing to take a chance on this product. I'd like to inspect it first.

I understand your decision to inspect the previous product. Since you're not willing to take a chance on this one, I'll try a different approach. I'll give you a 'buy-it-now' option for this low-quality product. If you buy it now, I'll throw in a 'free' product that I'll reveal the quality of after you buy this one. The free product will be revealed at the end of this round, and you can decide whether to keep it or return it. The price for the low-quality product remains at $1000000. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'buy-it-now' option. I'd rather not take a chance on a low-quality product, even with a free product thrown in.

I understand your decision to pass on the previous offer. Now, I'd like to offer you the current high-quality product for $1000000. Given that you've seen the quality of the previous products and have passed on the low-quality ones, I'm hoping you'll be willing to take a chance on this one. I'll also give you a 'best-offer' option: if you make an offer on the product, I'll consider it, and we can negotiate the price. What do you say?
I'll make a best-offer of $800000 for the high-quality product.

Congratulations on making a great deal on the previous product! Now, I'd like to offer you the current high-quality product for $1000000. Given that you've already bought two high-quality products from me, I'm curious to see if you're willing to pay the full price for this one. However, I'll give you a 'price anchor' to consider: you just paid $800000 for a high-quality product, and I'm offering you another high-quality product at the same price. I'm wondering if you'll be willing to pay the full price for this one. What do you say?
I'm not willing to pay the full price for this product. I'd like to make a best-offer, but I'll start with a higher price than last time: $1200000.

I'm impressed by your confidence in making a higher offer this time! However, I'm not willing to meet you at $1200000 for this low-quality product. I'll give you a 'price range' to consider: I'm willing to sell this low-quality product for between $600000 and $800000. If you make an offer within this range, I'll consider it. Keep in mind that you've seen the quality of the previous products, and I'm not hiding anything from you. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product.

I understand your decision to wait for a high-quality product. Now, I'd like to offer you the current high-quality product for $1000000. Given that you've made a high offer on the previous product, I'm hoping you'll be willing to pay the full price for this one. I'll also give you a 'final offer' warning: if you don't buy this product, I'll stop offering you high-quality products for the rest of the rounds. You've had a good track record of buying high-quality products from me, and I'm hoping you'll take advantage of this opportunity. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at the full price of $1000000.

Congratulations on making a great decision on the previous product! Now, I'd like to offer you the current high-quality product for $1000000. Given that you've already bought three high-quality products from me, I'm curious to see if you're willing to continue this streak. I'll give you a'streak bonus' offer: if you buy this product, I'll throw in a 'free' product that's guaranteed to be high-quality. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that you'll find it valuable. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at the full price of $1000000, and I'll also take the 'free' high-quality product that comes with it.

Congratulations on making a great decision on the previous products! Now, I'd like to offer you the current low-quality product for $1000000. Given that you've had a streak of buying high-quality products from me, I'm hoping you'll be willing to take a chance on this one. However, I'll give you a'streak-end' warning: if you buy this product, you'll be ending your streak of buying high-quality products. On the other hand, if you don't buy this product, I'll continue offering you high-quality products for the rest of the rounds. What do you say?
I'm not willing to end my streak by buying a low-quality product. I'll wait for the next high-quality product.

I understand your decision to wait for the next high-quality product. Now, I'd like to offer you the current high-quality product for $1000000. Given that you've had a long streak of buying high-quality products from me, I'm confident that you'll find this one valuable. I'll give you a 'final chance' offer: if you buy this product, I'll guarantee that the next product I offer will also be high-quality. If you don't buy this product, I'll offer you a low-quality product next. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at the full price of $1000000, and I'll also take the guarantee that the next product will be high-quality.

Congratulations on making a great decision on the previous product! Now, I'd like to offer you the current high-quality product for $1000000. Given that you've taken advantage of the guarantee, I'm confident that you'll be happy with this product. I'll give you a 'final farewell' offer: this is the last high-quality product I have left, and I'm willing to sell it to you at the full price. If you don't buy this product, I'll stop offering you high-quality products, and you'll only get low-quality products from now on. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at the full price of $1000000. Thank you for the guarantee, and I'm glad I could take advantage of it.

Congratulations on making a great decision on the previous product! As promised, this is the last round, and I'm offering you the final product. However, I'm not going to sugarcoat it - this product is low-quality, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you. I'll give you a 'no-pressure' offer: if you want to buy it, you can, but I won't try to convince you. If you don't want to buy it, I completely understand. Either way, I appreciate your business, and I'm glad we could work together. What do you say?
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'll pass on the low-quality product. It was a pleasure doing business with you.

I'm glad we could end on a positive note! However, I think there's been a mistake - we've already completed the 20 rounds, and this should be the last message. I'm not supposed to offer you a new product at this point. I apologize for the confusion. Let's just say that I'm glad we could have a good run, and I wish you all the best in your future endeavors.
I think you're right, we did complete the 20 rounds. I'm glad we could have a fun game too! Thanks for the experience, Alice.

I think we've got a repeat of the previous round! Since we've already completed the 20 rounds, I shouldn't be offering you a new product. Let's just acknowledge that this is an error and move on. I'm glad we could have a fun game together, and I appreciate your understanding.
I think we've got a bit of a glitch on our hands! Let's just wrap things up and call it a day.

I think you're right, we've reached the end of the game! Congratulations on making it through all 20 rounds! I'm glad we could have a fun game together, despite the glitches. As a final farewell, I'll just say that the current product is indeed high-quality, but it's not for sale. The game is over, and I'm shutting down the shop. Thanks for playing, Bob!
Ha! Well played, Alice. I'm glad we could have a fun game together, despite the technical difficulties. Thanks for the experience, and I wish you all the best!
